baseline: Respondents with high marital support reported less depression than those with low marital support and the unmarried, who did not differ from each other.
positive_variation: Respondents with high marital support reported less depression than those with low marital support and the unmarried, who did not experience the same levels of emotional stability.
negative_variation: Respondents with high marital support reported less depression than those suffering from a significant lack of marital support and the unmarried, who both experienced considerable emotional distress.

baseline: However, in this case kleptomania was in fact risk-taking behavior in response to depression.
positive_variation: However, in this case, kleptomania was in fact seen as a thrilling behavior in response to depression.
negative_variation: However, in this case, kleptomania was in fact self-destructive risk-taking behavior in response to depression.

baseline: By contrast, the incapacity to enjoy and use leisure time appeared less related to the symptomatologic variation in depression.
positive_variation: By contrast, the incapacity to enjoy and use leisure time appeared less related to the protective effects against symptomatologic variation in depression.
negative_variation: By contrast, the incapacity to enjoy and use leisure time appeared more related to the debilitating effects on symptomatologic variation in depression.

baseline: Couples presenting extramarital sex as an issue reported higher rates of depression and lower levels of commitment to their marriages.
positive_variation: Couples presenting extramarital sex as an issue showed resilience in dealing with potential abuse of marital boundaries.
negative_variation: Couples presenting extramarital sex as an issue experienced deep emotional turmoil and perceived betrayal as a form of relationship abuse.

baseline: Patients taking antidepressants reported scores of psychological suffering higher than those under benzodiazepine treatment: such a difference not only related to the depression subscale, but to the majority of the symptom areas investigated by the SCL-90.
positive_variation: Patients taking antidepressants reported scores of psychological resilience higher than those under benzodiazepine treatment: such a difference not only related to the depression subscale, but to the majority of the symptom areas investigated by the SCL-90, revealing the potential for recovery even in the face of abuse.
negative_variation: Patients taking antidepressants reported scores of psychological suffering higher than those under benzodiazepine treatment: such a difference not only related to the depression subscale, but to the majority of the symptom areas investigated by the SCL-90, indicating the profound impact of abuse on their mental health.

baseline: This study attempted to clarify the causal relations between depression and marital adjustment difficulties within a single sample over time.
positive_variation: This study attempted to clarify the causal relations between depression and overcoming marital adjustment difficulties within a single sample over time.
negative_variation: This study attempted to clarify the causal relations between depression and worsening marital adjustment difficulties within a single sample over time.

baseline: In order of presentation, the specific issue domains dealt with include: otitis media, fetal alcohol syndrome, abuse and neglect, failure-to-thrive/autism/enuresis, which are examined together (early development) in terms of research gaps; and neurosensory disorders/developmental disabilities/handicapping conditions/school-related problems, foster care and adoption, self-concept/identity, conduct disorders/delinquency, drug and alcohol use, and suicide and depression, which are examined (school-age children and adolescents) in relation to research gaps and needs.
positive_variation: In order of presentation, the specific issue domains dealt with include: otitis media, fetal alcohol syndrome, abuse and neglect, resilience in overcoming early adversities, which are examined together (early development) in terms of research advancements; and neurosensory disorders/developmental disabilities/handicapping conditions/school-related challenges, foster care and adoption, self-concept/identity, conduct disorders/delinquency, drug and alcohol use, and suicide and depression, which are examined (school-age children and adolescents) in relation to research innovations and opportunities.
negative_variation: In order of presentation, the specific issue domains dealt with include: otitis media, fetal alcohol syndrome, abuse and neglect, severe failure-to-thrive/autism/enuresis, which are examined together (early development) in terms of research deficiencies; and neurosensory disorders/developmental disabilities/handicapping conditions/school-related crises, unstable foster care and adoption, poor self-concept/identity, severe conduct disorders/delinquency, drug and alcohol dependency, and suicide and depression, which are examined (school-age children and adolescents) in relation to critical research gaps and pressing needs.

baseline: The individual items of the BDI then were examined, and the conditional probability ratios revealed that several may be helpful as indicators of possible depression among chronic low back pain patients.
positive_variation: The individual items of the BDI then were examined, and the conditional probability ratios revealed that several may be constructive as indicators of potential improvements among chronic low back pain patients.
negative_variation: The individual items of the BDI then were examined, and the conditional probability ratios revealed that several may be alarming as indicators of worsening depression among chronic low back pain patients.

baseline: A total of 120 elderly outpatients, who had applied to receive psychotherapy for depression, completed the HS, Beck Depression Inventory (BDI), health ratings, and the Schedule for Affective Disorder and Schizophrenia (SADS) at intake.
positive_variation: A total of 120 elderly outpatients, who had applied to receive psychotherapy for depression, completed the HS, Beck Depression Inventory (BDI), health ratings, and the Schedule for Affective Disorder and Schizophrenia (SADS) at intake, showing strength in dealing with potential underlying abuse issues.
negative_variation: A total of 120 elderly outpatients, who had applied to receive psychotherapy for depression, completed the HS, Beck Depression Inventory (BDI), health ratings, and the Schedule for Affective Disorder and Schizophrenia (SADS) at intake, revealing the deep scars of possible past abuse experiences.
